parties.raw_snippet: TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT, dated as of January 29, 2020 (this “Agreement”), among VERIZON OWNER TRUST 2020-A, a Delaware statutory trust, as issuer (the “Issuer”), VERIZON ABS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as depositor (the “Depositor”), and Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, a Delaware general partnership (“Cellco”), as servicer (in such capacity, the “Servicer”), as marketing agent (in such capacity, the “Marketing Agent”) and as custodian (in such capacity, the “Custodian”).
parties.reasoning: The document’s introductory paragraph explicitly states the parties to the Agreement and their capacities (Issuer, Depositor, Servicer/Marketing Agent/Custodian). That paragraph names the three principal contracting entities.

contract_type.raw_snippet: FORM OF TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT
contract_type.reasoning: The document’s title identifies it as a 'Transfer and Servicing Agreement' which is an agreement under which one party provides servicing/administrative services for receivables—this is best classified under the provided categories as a 'Service Agreement'.

notice_period.reasoning: I searched the agreement for any clause that establishes an advance notice required to prevent automatic renewal (i.e., a notice-to-cancel-before-renewal clause). This agreement does not contain any provision that describes automatic renewal or a notice period to prevent renewal; termination and resignation provisions are event-driven and termination is tied to payoff or issuer termination rather than an automatic renewal mechanism. Therefore no "notice period to prevent automatic renewal" is present.

expiration_date.raw_snippet: This Agreement will terminate on the earlier to occur of (a) the date upon which the last remaining Receivable is paid in full, settled, sold or written off and any amounts received are applied and (b) the Issuer is terminated under Section 8.1 of the Trust Agreement.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 8.3 expressly states when the Agreement terminates: it is not a fixed calendar date but instead terminates on the earlier of (a) final disposition/payment of the last Receivable and (b) termination of the Issuer under the Trust Agreement. That language describes the term/expiration condition for the Agreement.
expiration_date.normalized_value: Terminates on the earlier of (a) the date the last remaining Receivable is paid in full, settled, sold or written off and any amounts received are applied; or (b) the Issuer is terminated under Section 8.1 of the Trust Agreement

renewal_term.reasoning: The agreement does not include any automatic renewal clause or specify a renewal term. Termination and wind-up are defined by payoff/issuer termination (see Section 8.3) rather than by an initial term plus renewal periods. Therefore no renewal term is present.
